title: Firm produces where P equals MC, even below ATC

content.question: Suppose that price in a perfectly competitive industry decreases and it is now below minimum average total cost but remains above minimum average variable cost. Which of the following will occur in the short run?

choices.label: New firms will enter the industry.
Firms will increase output so that marginal revenue equals the new price.
Firms will produce the output at which average total cost is at a minimum.
Firms will produce the output at which marginal cost equals the new price.
Firms will not produce at all, since they will be unable to cover all their costs.

content.answer: Firms will produce the output at which marginal cost equals the new price.

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
